title: Poster, Post Modern Typography: Recent American Developments, May 8-26, Ryder Gallery, ca. 1975
title_raw: Post Modern Typography: Recent American Developments, May 8-26, Ryder Gallery
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
inscribed:
Printed in grid format across surface of poster: 
[24 yellow dots] /
"Post-Modern Typography: Recent American Developments" / represents a survey of recent visual / designs that uses typography / not only to / inform but / to / express - / type that explains / an idea / and in / cases almost visually becomes / the idea. /

It is the first show / of its kind to depict a body of work / in which the typography is / intended to go beyond / the utter functionalist /  rationnalism / [27 yellow dots] / of / modern / typography / to an / absolute / visual / unification / of content / and form.

At center left in red:  May 8-26 / 11-3:30 Monday-Friday / or by appointment / at anytime/ Ryder Gallery/ [8 yellow dots] / 500 N. Dearborn / chicago / 312 467 7117
description: Design using blocks of gray printed text alternating with yello, blue, pink and gray blocks that resemble text areas. Title and gallery name in dark blue ink. Image is the text.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, Post Modern Typography: Recent American Developments, May 8-26, Ryder Gallery, ca. 1975. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. 
Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-214
